user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_softirq_allocate:
```c
int metal_softirq_allocate(int num)
{
	int irq_base;

	if ((metal_softirq_avail + num) >= metal_softirq_num) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "No more available soft irqs\n");
		return -EINVAL;
	}
	irq_base = metal_softirq_avail;
	irq_base += metal_softirq_cntr.irq_base;
	metal_softirq_avail += num;
	return irq_base;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function metal_softirq_allocate:
#define metal_log(level, fmt, __VA_ARGS__) ({if(_metal.common.log_handler&&level<=_metal.common.log_level)_metal.common.log_handler(level,metal_fmt(fmt),##__VA_ARGS__);\
})
...
static int metal_softirq_avail
...

...
static METAL_IRQ_CONTROLLER_DECLARE(metal_softirq_cntr,
				    METAL_IRQ_ANY, METAL_SOFTIRQ_NUM,
				    NULL,
				    metal_softirq_set_enable, NULL,
				    metal_softirqs)
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
static METAL_IRQ_CONTROLLER_DECLARE(metal_softirq_cntr,
				METAL_IRQ_ANY, METAL_SOFTIRQ_NUM,
				NULL,
				metal_softirq_set_enable, NULL,
				metal_softirqs)
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the shown fragment. The METAL_IRQ_CONTROLLER_DECLARE macro here only declares/initializes a controller and passes the function pointer metal_softirq_set_enable; there is no evidence any function calls itself. A concrete violation would require metal_softirq_set_enable to call itself (direct recursion) or call another function that eventually calls metal_softirq_set_enable (indirect recursion). For example, if the macro expanded to create a function init_controller() that calls metal_softirq_set_enable, and metal_softirq_set_enable called init_controller(), that mutual call would violate Rule 17.2.
